tool.name: Visualize markers across celltypes

configfiles.configfile: import scanpy as sc import muon as mu from muon import atac as ac atac_data = sc.read_h5ad("$atac_input") #set $marker_genes = ([x.strip() for x in str($marker_genes).split(',')]) marker_genes = $marker_genes ac.pl.dotplot(atac_data, marker_genes, '$groupby', save="atac_marker_genes.png")

param.name: groupby
param.label: The key of the observation grouping to consider.
param.help: as defined in your AnnData file, (groupby in scanpy.pl.dotplot())

param.name: marker_genes
param.label: Marker genes
param.help: marker genes to visualize, should be comma-separated
param.value: IL7R, TRAC, GATA3, SLC4A10, CD8A, CD8B, CD248, CCL5, GNLY, NKG7, CD79A, MS4A1, IGHD, IGHM, TNFRSF13C, IL4R, KLF4, LYZ, S100A8, ITGAM, CD14, FCGR3A, MS4A7, CST3, CLEC10A, IRF8, TCF4

param.name: marker_genes
param.value: IL7R, TRAC, GATA3, SLC4A10, CD8A, CD8B, CD248, CCL5, GNLY, NKG7, CD79A, MS4A1, IGHD, IGHM, TNFRSF13C, IL4R, KLF4, LYZ, S100A8, ITGAM, CD14, FCGR3A, MS4A7, CST3, CLEC10A, IRF8, TCF4

tool.help: This tool visualizes marker genes across celltypes for ATAC-seq data as a dotplot.
